definition.simple_html:
template <class Visitor>
void customVisit(Visitor&& v) const
definition.simple_raw:
template <class Visitor>
void customVisit(Visitor&& v) const
definition.detailed_html:
template <class Visitor>
inline void customVisit(Visitor&& v) const
definition.detailed_raw:
template <class Visitor>
inline void customVisit(Visitor&& v) const

description.detailed_html:
Users should provide a visitor with the following methods 

struct Visitor {
  void assign(const String&);
  void clear();
  void prepend(const String&);
  void append(const String&);
}

For example: 

auto patch = StringPatch::createPrepend("(");
patch += ")";

patch.customVisit(v) will invoke the following methods 

v.prepend("(");
v.append(")");
description.brief_html: This API uses Visitor pattern to describe how patch will be applied. When a certain operation will be performed by the patch, the corresponding method (that matches the write API) will be called.

declaration_raw:
template <
  typename Patch,
  typename Derived
> class BaseStringPatch;

description.detailed_html:
Base class for string/binary patch types.

The Patch template parameter must be a Thrift struct with the following fields:

  • optional T assign

  • terse bool clear

  • terse T append

  • terse T prepend

definition.detailed_html:
template <typename U>
inline void merge(U&& next)
definition.detailed_raw:
template <typename U>
inline void merge(U&& next)

description.detailed_html: Merges another patch into the current patch. After the merge (patch.merge(next)), patch.apply(value) is equivalent to next.apply(patch.apply(value)).

overloadsets.brief_html: Merges another patch into the current patch. After the merge (patch.merge(next)), patch.apply(value) is equivalent to next.apply(patch.apply(value)).
